tournament.name: Week of Wings Entry Event Monday Flight 1

decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing mill mechanics and disruption spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to mill the opponent's library using cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, while also controlling the board with counterspells like Essence Scatter and removal spells like Heartless Act. By keeping the opponent's resources in check and depleting their library, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this Rakdos Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and graveyard interaction. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by utilizing cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Ox of Agonas to generate card advantage while applying pressure. The deck also includes cards like Liliana, Waker of the Dead for additional card advantage and disruption. By disrupting the opponent's plans and controlling the game, the deck aims to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and maintaining card advantage. It utilizes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and cards that provide card draw. The win condition is to outlast the opponent by gradually gaining card advantage with cards like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Mazemind Tome while controlling the board with removal spells like Extinction Event and Shadows' Verdict. The deck aims to stabilize the board and win the game in the late game with powerful threats like Shark Typhoon.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and powerful enchantments to create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. By playing creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Wicked Wolf alongside cards like The Great Henge and Turntimber Symbiosis, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain momentum throughout the game. With additional support from cards like Glass Casket and Elspeth Conquers Death, the deck can control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans while continuously developing its own game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and resilience.

Utilizing a high number of cards with enter the battlefield effects and strong removal spells, this deck aims to control the board while generating card advantage. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a powerful companion that allows the player to blink their permanents for additional value. By generating a long game advantage through its control elements and card draw, the deck is able to outlast opponents and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures with high power and attacking aggressively to pressure the opponent. By utilizing strong early game threats like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, along with powerful finishers like Embercleave, the deck aims to end the game as quickly as possible. The inclusion of cards like Robber of the Rich and Edgewall Innkeeper provide additional card advantage and options for card selection. With a mana base that allows for consistent plays and access to a variety of powerful threats, this deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful enchantments. Utilizing cards that generate additional resources, such as Gilded Goose and Llanowar Visionary, allows for a fast start while cards like Skyclave Apparition and Wicked Wolf provide solid removal options. The deck aims to maintain a steady board presence and apply pressure with a mix of aggression and resilience. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad also allows for additional value from entering the battlefield triggers, enhancing the deck's overall strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells and powerful threats. By ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra, the deck aims to cast big spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The creatures in the deck, such as Terror of the Peaks and Beanstalk Giant, serve as win conditions or ways to control the board. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by effectively managing resources and using versatile cards to take control of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to quickly fill up the graveyard and power up Zenith Flare for massive damage. The goal is to be aggressive with small creatures like Drannith Stinger and Valiant Rescuer while also disrupting your opponent's plan with spells like Memory Leak. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can be used to bring back key cycling cards or creatures from the graveyard for extra value. By cycling through your deck quickly and efficiently, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board by using removal spells and counters, while also milling the opponent with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber. The goal is to slow down the opponent's game plan, disrupt their strategy, and eventually win by reducing their library to zero cards through mill effects. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can provide additional value by recurring low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck utilizes a mix of removal, counterspells, and mill cards to maintain control over the game and outlast the opponent.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and graveyard interaction while maintaining card advantage with cards like Into the Story. By controlling the board with cards like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch, and utilizing synergies with cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win the game through efficient control of the game state.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Questing Beast, Gemrazer, and Brushfire Elemental. The deck also includes removal spells like Thundering Rebuke and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board. The goal is to deal early damage and finish the game quickly with the powerful Embercleave. The deck also includes cards like Scavenging Ooze and Inscription of Abundance for added versatility and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing cards like Torbran, Anax, and Embercleave, the deck aims to deal large amounts of damage in a short amount of time. The inclusion of efficient creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich helps maintain pressure on the opponent, while spells like Shock and Shatterskull Smashing provide additional removal and reach. With a strong mana base of 15 Mountains and Castle Embereth, this deck aims to win through fast, decisive attacks.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to clear the board and gain card advantage. It also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Cultivate and Lotus Cobra to play big threats like Terror of the Peaks and Beanstalk Giant. By efficiently managing resources and board state, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a longer game. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth mana curve and consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Cultivate to ramp into powerful threats like Genesis Ultimatum and Terror of the Peaks. It aims to control the game by managing the opponent's board with removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and finish the game with a devastating Genesis Ultimatum or Terror of the Peaks combo. The deck also includes some land utility cards like Fabled Passage and Ketria Triome for additional consistency.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing efficient removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recurring low-cost threats and utility cards. The key strategy is to maintain card advantage, disrupt opposing plays, and gradually chip away at the opponent's life total with evasive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief. The deck also includes a flexible mana base to ensure consistent access to its powerful spells.
